p: The most regular and usually the initial clinical sign was fever, which was present in 86% of patients and lasted for 4 (1–9) days. The median highest temperature was 39.3°C (38°C–41°C). Headache was reported by 65% of patients, mostly appearing early in the course of illness and with a median duration of 4 days. The other early symptom was myalgia, present in 40% of patients, most prominent on days 3 and 4, and lasting for a median of 5.5 days.
